transcript.text: shabbat shalom this is daniel john lee
with torah restoration ministries it is
Friday night October the 28th 2016 it is
the shabbat shabbat shalom to all of you
out there and it's the Sabbath after
sukkot and this is sort of a postscript
to Sukkot 2016 I didn't make any videos
during sukkot 2016 because quite frankly
I was too consumed with fellowship and
just enjoying the feast so I wasn't able
to make any videos which I'm not going
to apologize for because I think that's
the way Sukkot should be he should be so
involved with fellowship and enjoying
the feast that there's really no time to
make videos so I didn't make any videos
this sukkot but i did want to touch upon
a teaching that was sent to me during
sukkot which I it just really really
impacted me quite a bit it was right
toward the end of the feast and I wanted
to share it with you guys this is not my
teaching okay this is a teaching done by
hope of the world ministries which is a
ministry run by Jonathan Cahn um so this
is not my teaching but i do want to sort
of just repeat what he taught in this
particular lesson right of Sukkot was
ending because I just think it's so
powerful it's called the heavenly gaps
and it says during the feast of Sukkot
Tabernacles the people dwell in a
temporary dwelling called a sukkah when
you build your sukkah you leave gaps so
that when you sit underneath it you can
see the sky clouds the moon and stars at
night in life there are gaps some of
these gaps in your life are actually
heavenly when you look at what's missing
money comfort success strength abilities
friends family marriage health youth
whatever it is it's not always bad if
you had everything you wanted if your
life was a complete dwelling on earth
you wouldn't need you and you wouldn't
see heaven but the very gaps you want
clothes are off of there for your own
good
they're the gaps in the roof of your
sukkah so you don't forget the most
important things they're there so you
might see through the earthly things
which pass away beyond the skies to the
stars to the heavens to the face of yah
so rejoice than what you have and
rejoice and what you don't from the
absences and the gaps of your sukkah
there seven hallelujah and then today's
mission is take time today to reflect on
how temporary life is in comparison to
your eternal home in heaven dwell in the
heavenlies so I to me that's just really
really I'd never looked at a sukkah in
that way before but it's true you are
supposed to leave gaps in the roof of
your sukkah so you can look up and gaze
at the heavens and see the the stars and
you know see through the branches it's
supposed to be a temporary structure to
a temporary dwelling place which most
points back toward when the children of
Israel wandered through the wilderness
in temporary shelters pointing even
further back to how Abraham wandered
through the land of what would become
the Land of Israel but this was not his
permanent dwelling place that he had a
he was this was a temporary time and
there would be a permanent dwelling
place that he would have in the New
Jerusalem and just like we will we will
all have when yah and the fullness of
who he is actually sukas or Tabernacles
with man in the new heavens and new
earth which is what sukkot is all
pointing toward but so it's pointing
back toward that it's also pouring of
course toward what I just mentioned in
Revelation 21 and 22 about the new
heavens and new earth and yeah and the
fullness of who he is dwelling with with
us Joshua Joshua the son of yah the King
of Kings he delivers up his kingdom to
the father and the fullness of who he is
is now revealed to us like never before
and as Paul says I has not seen nor as
he heard nor can our mind even imagine
what that time is going to be like but I
just I was really hit by this because
you know there are definitely things in
my life that I know are missing and I
you know I grieve about it sometimes but
then I realized wow it's true if I had
everything I wanted what kind of
Reliance what i have on Yahshua it's the
stuff that I don't have and it's often
the sorrow and the grief that brings me
closer to yawn and so I think that's
very very fitting to remember to always
remember that the things that of course
we rejoice some of things that we do
have but even in the things that we
don't you say thank you yeah thank you
for not giving me everything that I
wanted because that causes me to look to
you you did to fulfill those gaps in my
life that that I wish were filled but
that only really after rely on you to
fill hallelujah well shabbat shalom i
hope you all had a very very blessed
feast of Sukkot and may you all have a
very blessed first Sabbath after the
feast of Sukkot starting tonight shabbat
shalom this is daniel john lee with tour
restoration ministries website is ww
spirit and Torah calm
